sentence.Network_en: Spring was the real apex of the year; summer was bathos.
sentence.Network_cn: 春天是一年四季中真正的顶点, 而夏天是高潮后的低潮.

sentence.Network_en: He'll never be able to emerge from his bathos of coarseness and ignorance.
sentence.Network_cn: 他永远也不能从他那粗野无知中解脱出来.

sentence.Network_en: Worth's war was one that went from high excitement to moments of bathos.
sentence.Network_cn: 沃思经历了战争的最兴奋时期,直到战争的最后时刻.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 揪心的疼，基督教运动始于突降法（bathos），那么他的精神肯定有问题，男孩就走了，为建造者所拒斥。所以《青瓷》的写作其实 …
不过, 本诗的"后神话"历程在末尾所抵达的不是高潮,而是突降(bathos): 他也不知道一得到公主游戏就结束了鸿鸿以他专业的戏剧手段营造了一个反讽式的戏剧性.
DmC：恶魔猎人－让天使尖叫、魔鬼哭泣！ -... ... ↑↑↑小型幽影( Lesser Stygian) ↑↑↑陈腐之尸( Bathos) ↑↑↑悲怆之躯( Pathos).
(炮)管 bathos 顿降法,陈腐乏味,虚伪 bauble belletristic 纯文学的 berth 停泊地,卧铺,职位,使停泊 beseech 恳求,哀求 bestial bevy bilk 赖账,欺骗,挫败.

list.abs: a untruthful guy 爱说谎的人a bathos guy 陈腐虚伪的人a false guy 无信义的不老实的人
bathmos 小窝, batho 水深测量器, batho 巴索

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (first recorded in the Greek sense): from Greek, literally depth'. The current sense was introduced by Alexander Pope in the early 18th cent

entry.def: In literary criticism, bathos is a sudden change in speech or writing from a serious or important subject to a ridiculous or very ordinary one.

means.word_mean: 3. a change from a serious subject to a disappointing one

auth_sentence.content: Declining...to the very bathos of insipidity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Declining...to the very bathos of insipidity.

auth_sentence.content: Come in Daily Express, your taste for bathos knows no bounds.
auth_sentence.res_content: Come in Daily Express, your taste for bathos knows no bounds.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Come in Daily Express, your taste for bathos knows no bounds.

auth_sentence.content: That is why the book, for all its celebratory tone, never falls into bathos.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is why the book, for all its celebratory tone, never falls into bathos.
